summary: "Thriller," Michael Jackson's sixth album, came out in 1982 and was produced by Quincy Jones. It mixed pop, rock, funk, and R&B sounds and had darker themes. Paul McCartney sang on "The Girl Is Mine." The album had seven top 10 hits, with "Beat It" and "Billie Jean" reaching number one. It spent 37 weeks at number one on the Billboard charts and sold 32 million copies by 1983, making it the best-selling album ever. The "Thriller" music video was a big hit on MTV. The album won eight Grammy Awards and remains the best-selling album of all time, with an estimated 70 million copies sold.
title: Thriller (album)
